security: Disclosing that the Office of Security would not favorably entertain a request for R. L. Crozier's utilization in a staff capacity due to his “current non-staff status and cover and security considerations involved in connection with his current assignment in (Mexico) as a Career Agent” reveals operational details and the covert nature of his work.
summary: A memo from the A/Chief of SB/2 to the Chief of IB/3, confirming that the Office of Security will not approve R. L. Crozier's assignment to Isolation due to his current non-staff status, cover, and security considerations related to his assignment in Mexico as a Career Agent.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated December 24, 1959, from A/Chief of SB/2, Ervan E. Kuhnke, Jr., to the Chief of IB/3, confirms that Joseph King, SO/OTR was verbally advised that the Office of Security will not approve a request to assign R. L. Crozier to a staff position at Isolation. The decision is based on Crozier's non-staff status, his cover, and the security considerations stemming from his current assignment in Mexico as a Career Agent. OTR will inform WH Division that they cannot assign Crozier to Isolation for security and cover reasons.
title: CROZIER, R. L.
